forum.name: suggestions
forum.description: got a new feature idea for anyland, or anything that could be improved?
forum.latestCommentText: i wonder if the game can actually handle that many script lines.

thread.title: when overlaps [thing]

comments.text: i would love to have a function for detecting range using things with no collision enabled by detecting when the source thing's collision box overlaps with another named thing
(or anything at all) this way we can detect distant inputs without a stutter from having to switch back and forth between collision states.
for instance, you could use a no-collided sphere to detect objects that float within its radius, not being limited to always projecting towards that specific thing
the thing's "..." -> "more" -> "can pass through" may help you. it makes the part uncollidable, yet still listen to touch event scripts!
great idea philipp, but i think that only affects players and emitted objects.
nic, i have can pass through on my data scanners. it works fine for placed things!

thread.latestCommentText: nic, i have can pass through on my data scanners. it works fine for placed things!
